ir:
For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable step will be updated to 5.
- the state variable minimum will be updated to 0x2386f26fc10000.
- the state variable stakingrequirement will be updated to 0x2386f26fc10000.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to caller.
  - the state variable ownerwallet will be updated to caller.

For the transferOwnership function, it has 2 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, address.
- When the first argument does not equal to 0, and for owner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to the first argument.
  - the state variable ownerwallet will be updated to the second argument.

For the payable fallback function.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than minimum:
  - When the checkinvestments of the address is not greater than 0:
    - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
    - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) equals to 0:
      - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) does not equal to 0:
      - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
  - When the checkinvestments of the address is greater than 0, and the balance of the address is greater than 0:
    - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
    - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
    - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) equals to 0:
      - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
      - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:
        - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
          - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
        - When (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and for users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address):
          - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) does not equal to 0:
      - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
      - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:
        - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
          - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
        - When (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and for users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address):
          - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
    - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:
      - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to (the checkwithdrawals of the address+(0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)).
        - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
        - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
        - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
      - For users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address):
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to (the checkwithdrawals of the address+(((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address)).
        - it transfers ether valued (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
        - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
        - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.

For the bounty function.
- When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than the checkreferral of caller, and the checkreferral of caller is not smaller than minimum:
  - it transfers ether valued the checkreferral of caller to caller. Afterthat, 
    - the checkreferral of caller will be updated to 0.

For the payable buy function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than minimum:
  - When the checkinvestments of the address is not greater than 0:
    - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
    - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) equals to 0:
      - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) does not equal to 0:
      - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
  - For users, except for the first argument, and the checkinvestments of the first argument is not smaller than stakingrequirement, and the first argument does not equal to 0:
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) equals to 0:
      - the checkreferral of the first argument will be updated to the checkreferral of the first argument.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) does not equal to 0:
      - the checkreferral of the first argument will be updated to (the checkreferral of the first argument+((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100)).
  - When the checkinvestments of the address is greater than 0, and the balance of the address is greater than 0:
    - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
    - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
    - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) equals to 0:
      - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
      - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:
        - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
          - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
        - When (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and for users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address):
          - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
    - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) does not equal to 0:
      - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
      - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:
        - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
          - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
        - When (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and for users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address):
          - it transfers ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)*5)/100) to ownerwallet.
    - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:
      - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to (the checkwithdrawals of the address+(0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)).
        - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
        - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
        - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
      - For users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address):
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to (the checkwithdrawals of the address+(((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address)).
        - it transfers ether valued (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
        - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the checkinvestments of the address+the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)).
        - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.

For the withdraw function.
- When the balance of the address is greater than 0:
  - When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0:
    - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to (the checkwithdrawals of the address+(0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)).
    - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
    - For users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0, and ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0:
      - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to (the checkwithdrawals of the address+(0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)).
      - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
  - For users, except ((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100) equals to 0, and (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and the balance of the address of this contract is greater than (((((the checkinvestments of the address*step)/100)*((current time-the balance of the address)/60))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address), and for users, except the checkinvestments of the address equals to 0:

For the bounty function.
- When the balance of the address of this contract is greater than the checkreferral of caller, and the checkreferral of caller is not smaller than minimum:
